meanings.definition: To have a presentiment of; to anticipate or foresee.
meanings.sent2: She always forefeels when something bad is about to happen.
meanings.sent3: He could forefeel the surprise party before it even started.
meanings.sent4: As the clouds darkened, she forefelt the impending rain.
meanings.sent5: His ability to forefeel danger saved them from harm.

meanings.definition: To have a feeling or intuition about something before it happens.
meanings.sent1: They forefeel the outcome of the game.
meanings.sent2: I often forefeel the answers before the questions are asked.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to forefeel the earthquake and ran outside.
meanings.sent4: She could forefeel the tension in the room before anyone spoke.
meanings.sent5: The old man could forefeel changes in the weather with accuracy.
